text:
The CHANGES should include the official release date for each version beside the version number.

This will make it easier to identify how old a current version is without having to download the old version to get this information.
creator: business2008@rodneybeede.com

text: It'd be nice to see this in http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/CHANGES_2.2
creator: business2008@rodneybeede.com

text: I download the Unix source tar.gz from an apache.org mirror, but the STATUS file is not included.  It'd be useful to have this file included in the source tar.gz.
creator: business2008@rodneybeede.com

text:
It is useful because when my company is using version 2.2.4, and I want to tell
them to upgrade to the latest version I can easily tell them how old that
version is.  That encourages them to do the upgrade sooner instead of putting
it off.
creator: business2008@rodneybeede.com
rbowen@apache.org
text: Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: Thanks for the report, I've clarified/emphasized that it's response headers from the origin server.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: ignore last comment, wrong bug updated.

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text:
This information is in the STATUS file, which is here: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/httpd/httpd/trunk/STATUS and here: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/httpd/httpd/branches/2.2.x/STATUS

Is that sufficient for your needs, or are you looking for more than that?
